Posts.Content: Yes Anne I live in Manchester and have known Mike for years (we did our teacher training together in the late 80s) where do you live inManchester? I love Maggies and have done the yoga there rather than the choir. I really don’t have any musical ability so you’re better off without my dulcet tones!
Posts.Title: Cold Feet (The TV programme not the things on the end of your legs...

Posts.Content: I wouldn’t think that Jenny’s reaction is anything like the typical reaction. I was numb for days and went into autopilot. The waiting for results is almost unbearable. If you think of any drama which has comedy aspects they have to sanitise it or no one would watch it. That’s what cold feet is a comedy drama.  Thinkof how well the young suicidal man made such a startling recovery. We all know that life is never that straightforward. I agree that the pressure on people with whatever illness (and I have personal experience of mental illness too) to be strong and brave can be counter productive. I think you are allowed to be as emotional as you like of it helps. I found that support groups are a life line so please let me know how you get on. Xx
Posts.Title: Cold Feet (The TV programme not the things on the end of your legs...

Posts.Content: You must know my friend Mike then because you’re standing next to him! X
Posts.Title: Cold Feet (The TV programme not the things on the end of your legs...

Posts.Content: hi has anyone been watching the new series of Cold Feet on ITV? If so do you think Jenny is depicting the experience well?. I live in Manchester and am currently studying for a degree as a (very) mature student so it is very close to home for me. - literally. :) I have to say applying for an assignment extension wasn’t quite as straightforward as Jenny made out. The best bits for me was when she said to her friend ‘It’s not ok it’s sh*#’ and the lovely scene in the hospital with the young man. I hope people are having a good day x

Posts.Title: Cold Feet (The TV programme not the things on the end of your legs...

Posts.Content: feeling a bit wobbly this evening. Has anyone had bad migraine type headaches with letrazole? Went to the GP as I thought my headaches were a side effect but he’s sent me for an urgent brain scan to rule out cancer! He said he wouldn’t be doing his job properly if he didn’t send me but still my mind’s in overdrive......... on a positive note no side effects from radiotherapy. Trying to look on the bright side :).......
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply 323pookie. Yes I’m hoping it’s just the meds. What kind of eye problems did you have?
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan

Posts.Content: Hi ronstar feeling a lot better today thank you and the headache has gone. Really strange actually because I went out last night for a celebration because my treatment had ended, had Japanese food a couple of beers and went dancing and today feel better than everyone else!!!  You are are right I’m looking at it as the Gp doing it as a precautionary measure because I presented with the symptoms. I can’t change anything by worrying so I’m trying not to. Of course the beer helped :)  thank you for replying. It’s is so great to know that there are people who get it and who are kind enough to reply.
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply 323pookie. Yes I’m hoping it’s just the meds. What kind of eye problems did you have?
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan

Posts.Content: Thank you for this Sue. Very encouraging. I hope you are doing well now. Plus my headaches seem to have gone. (for now at least.) x
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan

Posts.Content: Hi @323pookie  I’m feeling much better now thank you with headaches still gone. Very stiff neck though and general joint stiffness. I think I’ve put on weight too. I feel a lot calmer too which is a good thing. It does sound like letrazole has quite a lot of horrible side effects. Your eye problem sounds awful so fingers crossed the change of meds works for you. Let me know how it goes Bye for now
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan
